content.detailedDescription: Wife was nursing baby, said she saw a light in the sky while watching fireworks through window.  went outside with binoculars and viewed glowing orange object ~ 1 mile se hovering, and then floating easterly.  it dissipated after a few minutes and was viewed again ~ 0.5 mile se, hovered and then moved se.  dissipated. no wind.  tried to get focus on light but difficult.  positive it was not burning material from fireworks, was my initial guess.
content.summary: Two objects appeared, dissappeard while watching fireworks.  not burning remenants

content.detailedDescription:
We were outside doing fireworks on the 4th of july. we saw some fireworks go off in the distance and then noticed a red-orange orb come straight up from behind some trees (but it looked like it was farther away - several miles) and stop. thinking it may have been part of the fireworks, we watched it, expecting it to blow up. it stayed in the same spot for about 10 seconds and then slowly started drifting east through the sky. as it started drifting, we noticed another orb following behind it, moving at the exact same speed. we all just looked at it, in awe, wondering what it was (even kids were asking what they were). at that time one of us ran inside to grab a camera and filmed it. it continued to slowly move east through the sky and then the first one disappeared behind a cloud, followed by the second one. 

please note that in the video, there is a reflection from a streetlight that you can see between the 2 orbs. it was a cloudy evening and you can see the objects disappear into the clouds, one after the other.
content.summary: Two red-orange orbs float slowly across the sky during fireworks.

content.detailedDescription:
Went out on the 4th of july with my four kids at the onset of neighbors fireworks.  as we waited and watched for fireworks, a huge black circular sphere flew above us (at about 30 feet).  it seemed to glow with a reddish/orange light at the bottom.  within ten seconds, no more light was visible and the black sphere flew across in a straight line towards mt rainier.  

i observed it with curiosity.  it was unaffected by wind and did not move off course; it just went straight by us and we watched it continue until out of sight.  within a minute, three more spheres flew off heading the same direction as the first one and then seemed to change course and again head straight towards mt rainier.  they were farther away in the distance in tree lines of evergreen trees, but i could estimate that they were large by the fact that they were dwarfing the trees.

additionally, within another minute, two more spheres flew by in a straight line.  

at this time, firework displays began all over and the night sky darkened.  i did not see any more after that.

scared me and my kids out of our minds.  they were huge black spheres (about 5-10 feet in diameter or bigger from where i was standing) that were completely silent.  they were way too big to be balloons.  they went in a straight direction without anything propelling them.  what has the ability to do that?  what could they possibly be?
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Black spheres flew across sky at start of 4th of july fireworks towards mt rainier

content.detailedDescription: I lost my cell phone so i went to the front yard to see if i could find it in my car.  it was  about 10:20 pm. i turned the lights on inside my car.  the cell was not in there so i closed the car doors.   i was standing in the street by my car.  i looked up and i saw this orange lit up thing in the sky and at first i thought of the moon, but not even.  it was about as high up as a blimp.  but we get blimps frequently, there was no sounds.  it appeared square and lit up orange lights and was just stationary.  i  could not imagine what it was so i just kept looking.  i thought it was a blimp at first but it was rectangular  i glared at it for maybe 10 seconds.  then i realized it was stationery and not moving, and then it began to move and than just took off wi lightening speed.  towards the east.  i ran into the house and yelled ufo  to my husband and son.  i told them to come out and bring the camera.  it was nowhere to be seen when it took off it was amazingly fast.  i have never seen anything like this before.  i looked on the internet to see if there were any other sightings.  strange on july 4.  my reactions.  i was just excited and could not believe what i saw.  i wished my spouse and son could have seen it for proof.  but when it took off it was so so fast and just disappeared.  the orange lights were similar  to the color  of the moon but brighter.  it almost looked like a whole bunch of small orange lights, and in the center of it almost looked like a number but as i watched it there was no number.  there was no other color just the orange.  no sound. then it began to move slowly, that is when i began to run to the house but i was still looking up at it, when i began to run it just took off towards the east with lightening speed and was completely totally disappeared.
content.summary: Rectangular object in sky july 4 2013 many orange lights bright and similiar to the color of the moon.  it was stationery and than began to move slowly than just took off wi lightening speed and it vanished it was gone.

content.detailedDescription: I was with friends watching several personal fireworks around a lake. i was looking around to see if there were any more fireworks. it was then that i noticed a bright orange, low, steady light moving through the sky.  i noticed it over the south side of the lake, moving northeast. as it came closer to me it faded almost instantly, off to the northeast. i was feeling  since i first saw this, that it was a ufo who had come to observe the fireworks.  it was huge and bright, unlike your typical flashing airplane light, and too large and low for a satellite, in my opinion.  i was amazed that i was seeing this. the object merely faded into space. it seemed as if i should have kept seeing it, since it was so huge and bright.  i mentioned it to my friend that did not see it. she agreed it was likely a ufo.  i am amazed that there are similar reports of this in other states.
content.summary: This was a bright orange light moving steady through the sky, as low as a small plane would fly.

content.detailedDescription: My father went outside to smoke a cigarette, and about five minutes later he's shouting my name to come outside. when i came out he pointed to the sky (which was pretty clear other than the fireworks going off) and i saw an object in the sky hovering very slowly it completely stood out because the night was so clear  it was grey and standoffish. it almost looked 3d against the sky, it moved slowly in a straight direction. i had been observing for about a minute and a half when a firework went off in that direction and it just got sucked into the sky. it all happened very quickly. i tried getting it on video on my phone,but had no luck because it was too dark outside i ended up only recording our reactions to what we were seeing. this isn't our first time experiencing something like this we saw a ufo christmas 2011 hovering literally above our neighborhood and one point it was right above a tree we have in our front yard. we were pretty terrified because it was so close and completely strange. that ufo was a orange reddish color and the edges were fuzzy against the sky and when it was right above our tree everything got creepily quiet and you could almost hear a hum. this time i was frozen in fear i couldn't even move to get my phone and when i ended up snapping out if it it was too late and it was gone.
content.summary: Grey oval with glowing flashing lights

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside setting a trap for field mice that live in the shoulder of the road next to the mobile home park i live in. i look up and watch what i thought was more fireworks, but it was 4 lights coming from the southwest. there was distance between each other, whether it was equal distance i couldn't tell you. then each consecutive light went out, and went black. i then watched two of them, as they went black, head towards the cascade mountain foothills. this was at 10pm and i know it wasn't crows or turkey vultures heading towards the foothills. the objects from when the were lit, to when they were black, moved slow, they didn't zig zag, jump around, hover or anything else, they just went slow and made a heading n.Easterly. then a separate light, again like a low powered flare, came into view from a more south easterly direction, and when it passed over the main hiway i am next to (hiway 169), it too went dark, but i couldn't see it's shape because of the street light that was in my eyes.
i thought they might of been planes or helicopters but even with the fireworks noise, there were no lights after they went dark, no noise, they just were slow moving objects. i lost sight of the objects as they headed east towards the foothills, it's cloudy out and i could see the objects against the clouds. the last object that was by itself i couldn't follow once it went black because of the street light across the street.
content.summary: 4 lights close to each other with muted brightness of flares, then they went black

content.detailedDescription: I was watching a firework show. when it ended i went to call my dad and then i realized that everyone was looking up at the sky. i turned to look and i saw it. at first i thought it was a firework ember that was still lit. but it wasn't falling like one would. it was descending but very slowly. then i was afraid it was some kind of meteor or comet that was heading towards us and i drove forward thinking i would get out of the way of it. then i realized it wasn't far away like i originally thought. it was very close. possibly a few feet above the building we were next to. it was very bright and orange. it floated towards the building and then disappeared behind it. when we drove around the building to try and see it... it was gone.
content.summary: Appeared after firework show ended. certain was not a firework

content.detailedDescription:
Glowing object appeared as ball of fire at first, thought it was a firework dud on horizon, but came from an area where fireworks weren't present. then the object instead of falling like a dud firecracker, started to elevate. i used a pair of barska binoculars (10x50wa) used for aircraft spotting, and have a description of a glowing pulsating craft. it has a sweptback boomerang wing, a stubby triangular top section, but then the 'fuselage' is like the bottom keel on a sail boat; it streches down and is a right triangle in appearance. it glows yellow -orange, and it did a bank right toward the east above the protected wetlands area, heading near us-2. 

this was around 9:57pm pst, south east in direction, heading east toward us-2. it hovered and course corrected 2 mins into the 4 min flight, until i could no longer see it past trees.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Spotted ascending from trees, se from house 125 degrees.

content.detailedDescription:
Looking to the west and saw a strange glowing red/orange object moving from southwest to northeast. we watched it move northeast until it vanished from sight. 15 minutes later we were driving and saw another one almost overhead and moving to the north. we followed it as best we could until it too moved to far away to see. after returning home a few minutes later we saw another one in the east (the others were in the west) also moving slowing to the north. then about five minutes later we saw another moving to the northeast in the east. then suddenly we saw two, then three in a triangle and them three more moving together at the same rate of speed and the same size silently move to the north and then moving to far away to see anymore and then after an hour of this, there were no more.

they all looked perfectly identical. flickering glowing tear-drop shaped objects. all the same altitude airspeed and direction. they were perfectly silent with no flashing navigation lights and they looked the same from all directions whether from the back or sides of front.

we were just curious at first then grew very excited as we saw more and more and them fleets of these things in formations.

they all moved north and got too far away to see anymore.
ne. this time i had binoculars and saw them close up. they looked like bright red/orange balls of light slightly flickering. my wife saw it too.

in total the entire event was just over one hour. from about 9:30pm to 10:30pm and then from 11:35pm to 11:50pm

at midnight we retired indoors.
content.summary: Flickering, glowing orangish-red ovals moving silently alone, in pairs and in a triangle from south to north at same altiitudes

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i went to the local park to watch the 4th of july fireworks.  we were looking up as the fireworks were supposed to start shortly. just after 9 as it became dark, 2 round solid lights (objects) approached from the south.  i thought they could be helicopters or military jets flying in close formation however it seemed that they were flying way too slow t obe jets, were way to big to be choppers (as well as making no sound). the two objects appeared as 2 bright yellow lights approx. 5x's the size of venus in the night sky. the were flying side by side and extremely close together and got so close that the space between them decreased until there was none. at this time they separated slightly while banking to the ne. one of the ufos then "turned off and was no longer visible as the other proceeded to the ne and approx. 30 sec. later it too disappeared (they did not fade, they disappeared).  about 2-3 minutes later two more identical objects appeared/approached? from in the same place headed in the same direction and performed the same movements until one of them disappeared and then the 2nd one disappeared as well.  we also noticed that neither of these objects/lights had no flashing lights as planes and helicopters are required to and made no sounds.  they displayed only one bright color, a pale very bright yellow. finally a fifth craft w/ no visible partner ufo approached from the same direction and on the same course and we lost sight of it as the fireworks started up.  there is absolutely no possibility that this was in any way an illusion or misperception of the fireworks (which did not even start until after the event ended.  neighbors also witnessed the ufos and were equally puzzled by it. also i am an amateur astronomer/sky-watcher so i am very familiar with astronomical event/objects and anomalies as well as flight vehicles in the daylight and nighttime.  i felt excited, curious and a bit frustrated at not being able to identify the craft.
content.summary: 2 pairs and a single ufo passed overhead. 2 of them disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks and and then we saw a circular light coming towards us and then it stopped, was stationary for about 45 seconds.  the clouds covered it, and it disappeared.  it was not fireworks and not a star.  my husband thought it was a meteor at first.  we got a picture of it.
content.summary: Happened while watching fireworks

content.detailedDescription:
As i was traveling home from store i saw an orange colored orb traveling at the rate a small plane might in a northwesterly direction. i was driving down a street that was relatively well wooded so i only caught glimpses of it before i turned east on a road to take me to my house. being the 4th of july i thought it may have been some type of firework,but frankly none i had ever seen before. i arrived home less than 10 minutes later, and as i was standing in my driveway speaking with my neighbor about the local festivities i glanced skyward and a similar orb,with the same speed and northwesterly trajectory passed (in the distance) above the roofline of my home, as well as her home's roofline. she observed it,and we yelled to her husband and daughter who were actually sitting on the roof of their one story house watching the various fireworks to turn around and look at the object. we all observed it travel that northwestern route for probably less than 90 seconds and then (at least from my perspective) disappear as it went below the roofline of my neighbor's home.
with cacophony on noise from the various fireworks, it was impossible to know if it made any sound. it's size and luminosity was at least twice what venus would be at its brightest times. 
being a retired police officer i can definitely say it was not any firework, or a chinese lantern. nor was it the space station, an orbiting satellite or anything launched from nearby cape canaveral or the ksc! my neighbor, who was on his roof, is a highly skilled computer programmer, he had no idea what the orb was. his spouse, who was in the driveway with me didn't have a clue either as to what we witnessed.Their daughter, who also saw it, is nine years old.
both orbs i viewed appeared identical. i do not believe they were one in the same, as the speed of the first would not have been fast enough for it to circle around so that i could have viewed it a second time when i arrived home. nonetheless, that is a remote possibility that cannot be ruled out.I made these observations approximately between the hours of 2045 and 2105 edt. there was probably 2 miles distance between my 2 sightings.
i did not photograph either object as i had left my iphone home as this was just a quick run to the grocery store.I can say these orbs looked very similar to some recent photos and videos of orange orbs i have seen on the internet.
content.summary: Saw two orange orbs approximately 10 mins apart, one while traveling home from store anotheasr after after i got home while s

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were walking home after the fireworks display.  looked up to see low flying airplane approx. 300 feet in altitude, following closely behind were 3 bright red-orange objects and one white object.  the first 3 then formed into a triangle ahead of the white object.  i took out my cell phone and filmed the objects for 1 minute 7 seconds.  the objects dissolved and disappeared.  the objects were flying slowly from south to north, following the shoreline of lake michigan.  they were approximately 300 feet in altitude.  we viewed the objects for approximately  3 minutes.  we knew immediately these were not airplanes, helicopters, balloons, fireworks or like anything we had ever seen before.
content.summary: Saw 4 bright low flying objects, flew into formation along lake michigan

content.detailedDescription: It was 10:45 in the evening my husband, son and i were leaving our old home after picking up some of our things as it was right by where we were viewing the fireworks this evening. i was walking across the street to retrieve the mail when i casually looked up into the sky a was stopped dead in my tracks by what i saw. i know that everyone's first reaction will be duh it's the fourth of july buys trust me these were no fireworks. what i observed were two bright glowing round orbs/lights red-orange in color in a perfect diagonal formation with a distance of around 100ft between them. my husband was called my name and i couldn't seem to find my voice i was so shocked at what i was witnessing. the lights proceeded to move northwest never straying from their formation. after what seemed like an enternity but was around 35 to 40 seconds the light on the left slowly began to fade out until it fully disappeared, the light on the right meanwhile was still fully bright and moving along. after another 10 to 15 seconds the second light on the right disappeared immediately, not fading just gone. still in shock i waited a while looking at the sky to see if the lights would return which they did not. there was never a sound only the noise of traffic. we asked those we saw in the neighboorhood if they had seen it as well including a police officer and everyone's answer was no. while i enjoying watching shows on aliens and ufo's i have always been a skeptic, but what i experienced tonight has truly shocked me and made me question the age old question are we alone? i'm hoping that by reporting this to mufon that i can get some answers or clarity to what i saw and experienced tonight.
content.summary: Two orange red glowing orbs moving about 100ft apart in a straight line moving in perfect incision at a diagonal rising in elevation orb on left slowing faded out first followed by light on right disappearing in an instants no fading

content.detailedDescription:
On july 4th at approximately 9:45, i walked out into my yard. i didn't do this to watch fireworks, i did this because oddly, my neighbor had someone cutting his grass in the dark. i walked outside to see what that was all about. 

when i looked across the street, i noticed an orange ball of light traveling at a brisk speed. i could see it approaching through the trees. i got my phone out (iphone) and started to record it. (i have video) 

when it made it into a clearing, i shot video and took some still photos. it flew over my house, and it appeared to be ascending after it past over. a few seconds after i lost visual, a second light, this time white'ish in color at an extremely rapid speed flew in the same direction as the first object.

about 5 minutes later, a second object looking exactly like the first one flew over again. i have video and still photos of it as well. 

there was no sound, no blinking lights, nothing.
content.summary: Either two separate orange colored objects flew over my house, or one with a 2nd fly bye

content.detailedDescription: Me and two friends were turning onto street into mobile home park, coming home from fireworks display. as we turned onto street i noticed up in the sky going east to west was a larger than starlike orangish red sphere traveling at a steady pace. i immediately said wow what is that to my friends. they didnt see it until we pulled into the driveway and i jumped out and pointed to it. by this time it was going right over us. they then spotted easily. as it flew over us and away it shrunk in size from being a larger than star object to being a star like object. it was cleary not a star or plane or anything like that. it made no sound. it just faded off behind the trees. we just stood there in awe. note: this was not a fireworks.
content.summary: Coming home with friends and turning west onto street. i spotted a larger than star object traveling above.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks over little lake conway on 4th of july 2013. the orlando international airport is in the distance to the east of us. the planes take off and land in one of two directions, north and south. coming towards us from the eastern sky were 5 orange-reddish lights in a line formation. this was very odd because there were planes coming in for landing from the north. nothing ever comes from the east, it is in the way of the planes path to the airport. the lights continued to come towards our direction steadily until they reached the end of the lake where we were standing then they turn to the north, at this point they were at the closest point to us. we could not make out what shape they were. we did not hear a sound from them. we watched them continue moving in a very smooth movement all 5 of them stayed in a row at a set distance from each other. the color is not a color of any aircraft we have ever seen. this is the second time we have seen these orange colored lights in this area. both times they were in places that planes do not fly. we know the path of the planes for the airport. we often sit at the lake and watch them come in for landing over the lake from the north to the south. the light then went behind the clouds one at a time. we were both in awe once again to see this twice in orlando.
content.summary: A line of 5 orange-red color lights in straight line moving slowly and then turning to the north

content.detailedDescription: While watching local fireworks display from the farm, i noted 4-5 dim lights appear on the eastern horizon...The lights slowly increased in intensity and formed a large triangular shaped, which moved very slowly southward.  the top two objects then assumed a matching altitude, merged into one light and then disappeared.  the remaining lights slowly dimmed and then disappeared.  the lights were very low on the eastern horizon from my viewing position.  a few minutes later, a single light would appear further to the north of the original incident, and then very slowly dim out of view.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 4-5 lights appear on eastern horizon and then slowly vanish

content.detailedDescription: My wife and daughter and myself were out in our backyard celebrating the 4th of july when i looked up at some rockets going off and noticed this strange object in the sky first i thought it was a helicopter it was to low to be a plane, anyhow my wife also noticed it and asked me what it was well went off to the northwest at a very high rate of speed, it disappeared and reapeared along ways away , in the course of an hour we observed this 3 times. i looked at it with my binoculars and it was no aircraft or fireworks. it looked orange on top and yellow on the bottom.
content.summary: Notice up in the sky very different.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks over a lake when we saw five silent glowing orange orbs moving slowly from se to ne over a period of 15-30 minutes.  most were solitary but two were near each other.  at first we thought it was an ember from a firework, but it didn't die off.  then we thought it might be a helicopter but it looked like it was on fire and there was no noise.  each orb moved in a straight line; with the exception of the two that were together they were well-spaced out.  we lost sight of each orb as it passed the treeline to the ne, then a new one would appear in the se.  we took multiple videos.  what are these orbs?
content.summary: Five silent glowing orange orbs moving from se to ne looked like fireballs

content.altitude: 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Unknown
content.detailedDescription: At around 9:30 pm on july 4th, 2013 my family and i were about 2 blocks away from the hudson river, in a very large crowd of people on the corner of 11th avenue and 50th street waiting for the fireworks that were starting at 9:30 pm.  i was with my father's girlfriend and her daughter while my dad was off looking for a better vantage point to see the show.  everyone in the crowd was facing west towards the hudson.  i believe i heard a helicopter flying lower than usual behind us so i turned to look, and i remember tilting my head back quite a bit to get it into view. above two buildings (i am not sure the exact angle or the building names), two red lights appeared moving from south east to north east followed by a helicopter.  the lights had a solid outline but still bright.  the lights were larger than any light i had ever seen in the sky before.  they almost looked like two red traffic lights however there was absolutely no glow to them unlike if you were to look at a stop light at night. (i have observed airplanes and landing gear lights and radio tower lights in the sky before and all of them have a slight glow to them.)  they moved north across the sky and were followed by a helicopter and i noticed that about halfway between my vantage of the buildings, each lights seemed to slow down and get slightly dimmer but remained the same size.  i got my father's girlfriend's daughter's attention and she observed the lights as well, and she became nervous that something was going to happen as it was our first time in new york and she had never seen anything like these lights before either.  i also noticed that at least two other people had turned around and saw them as well so i know there were other non-related witnesses.  they were speaking some sort of asian language as they pointed up at them.  i tried to also get my dad's girlfriend to see the lights but they were gone before i could get her attention.  the sighting lasted no longer than 30 seconds as the two lights and helicopter passed over a building to the north east.  i didn't think too much more about it at the time as the fireworks began to start over the hudson to the west.  about five to ten minutes later my dad's girlfriend asked me if i had cell service because she was trying to reach my dad.  i checked my phone as did her daughter, and none of us had service.  i tried calling my dad and my phone would not connect the call.  so i started writing a text message to him and pressed send.  it took a minute or two but finally i got confirmation that it was sent and all three of us immediately got our service back.  at first i did not connect the two events until after the fireworks show, at 10 pm, after meeting back up with my dad, i told him about what i saw and he said that he had lost service for a few minutes as well and he was a few blocks to the south of us.  his girlfriend heard my report for the first time as well and asked if we saw a ufo.  i told her that i did not know, but that made me remember how many ufo sightings were also reported having interference with electronic equipment and that got me thinking.  on our walk back to the hotel, i was almost constantly looking up in the sky trying to get another glimpse of the object for better observation but to no avail.  when we got back to our hotel at around 10:30, i got online and looked for any reports of red lights in the sky that night but found none.  i made this report because i know that other people saw the same thing that i did and i would like to know what it was as i am very intrigued.  i used to be very interested in ufo phenomenon however within the past few years i have somewhat dismissed the fact as being misidentified aircraft of some sort.  the way these lights looked, being unlike anything i have seen before, really has captivated me and i am very interested to see other reports or even get an explanation of what it could have been.  my dad gave the opinion that the government may have wanted to stop cell phone communication during the firework show as it was creating some very loud explosion noises that echoed through the buildings behind us.  after writing this report i am going to go on to microsoft paint and make a rough diagram of what i saw.
content.summary: Two solid red lights/orbs with no glow followed by a helicopter.

content.detailedDescription: It was july 4 at 905 pm. my brother came running in saying there is a ufo outside. me and my wife jumped up and ran outside. this is the second ufo i have seen outside my house. the only recording device i have is an iphone. could not get it to pick up the object. this object was visible for at least five mins.. granted it was the fourth of july but this was no firework. this looked like a bow that you shoot arrows with. it had thee lights from top to bottom. with the middle light the biggest.. when it left it headed west and moved very fast. this object was huge also no planes to compare it to, but well over five hundred feet.
content.summary: It a shape like half circle arc like a bow that you shoot with arrows. three lights top middle and bottom. middle was the biggest.

content.detailedDescription:
A friend and i decided to walk from my apartment to woodward ave to watch fireworks. halfway to the st. we noticed one then two constant lights in the sky moving in tandem upwards and away at a regular rate of speed. we stopped and observed and discussed what the objects were, and could not make a solid conclusion. we continued in discussion of the objects to the end of the st. watching surface to air fireworks. ten minutes approximately, we noticed a red light moving in the opposite direction followed by on other as  e had seen earlier. instead they were moving north east to south east same trajectory speed but with a red hue. we both agreed it wasn't anything we
 had seen before. and continued to discuss our own past sightings.
content.summary: Two yellow lights moving in tandem, out of atmosphere, with no blinking lights or sound. second sighting red in color.

content.altitude: 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
I keep my eyes on the skies. leaving the denville fireworks at approximately 9:45 with my husband walking approximately ssw when i spy an orange light coming in from the south. i noted the orange color and decided to watch it. i point it out to himself who looks and immediately pronounces it a plane. i point out to him that it is very bright orange with no blinking navigation lights. he takes notice and agrees. it is heading approximately north and i cannot make out the shape of the craft except to say that the bright steady light was an extended horizontal oval as it came closer to overhead. the flight path was smooth and moderately fast. i guess it could have been a chinese lantern but the shape and the unwavering course and steady pace say maybe not. i'd be interested to know if you get any other reports.
i lost sight of the object when my husband pulled me onto the curb for fear i might be hit by a car.
the light came from the south and moved nearly overhead toward where the fireworks had been. my feelings were of intense interest. i am now experiencing feelings of overheating and sweating though i am in my air conditioned home. i don't know if this is related. i also reported this to ken pfeifer. i have had other sightings in the past, some (like tonight) in the company of others.
content.summary: Bright steady orange light observed in denville nj about 7-8 minutes after the fireworks

content.detailedDescription: Orange glowing ufo today in central mass flying ne at low speed right after sunset. no, it was not a plane in route to boston (this object was flying lower then 10 thousand feet where boston heading planes fly) nor fire works, it was flying on a ne straight line, nor was it reflecting the light from the sun as it was glowing all around. it was of the cigar shape type with no visible wings
content.summary: Cigar shaped orange glowing object

content.detailedDescription:
My wife was watching fireworks and i went to do something and she looked out the kitchen window and said "look at that".  i did and it was nothing i had never seen before.  i saw 2 of them and tried to get a picture on my cell phone and couldn't find it in my viewfinder.  while doing that, #3 which i didn't see disappeared from my wife's view.  i kept trying to get pictures and none came out.

1. at home watching july 4th fireworks.
2.  my wife saw it (more later on).
3.  strange.  not normal.
4.  round with and orange glow.  there was no sound as they drifted almost directly above us.  four passed over and the third one i didn't see as i was trying to take pics.  they traveled in a straight line.
5.  no panic or concerns since we were not threatened.  as a former fireman, i felt comfortable and not in any danger.Calm persisted.
6.  they passed over our house to the north and we were on the south side.  i took a glance to the north but, the position wasn't right from my viewpoint.
content.summary: Five crafts #3 disappeared (evaporated). two more followed.

content.detailedDescription: During the fireworks display at bush gardens in williamsburg va.  i witnessed what appeared to be a triangular shaped object over the fireworks display.  object had a series of sequential flashing lights along what appeared to be one of its edges.  def not standard aircraft strobe style flashing lights.  these were larger light sources.  object appeared on one side of the fireworks display, behind and above.  moved from right to left.  once display ended.  object made a very sharp turn and went in a reverse direction.  this is went i made the determination that it was triangular.  no sound was emitted from it.  object headed way from the area and disappeared behind the distant trees.
content.summary: During and after fireworks display non standard aircraft lights were brought to my attention.  def triangle shaped.  made that determination after object turned.

content.detailedDescription: 2 red orbs silently flying from west to east.
content.summary: Red orbs

content.detailedDescription: My family and i watched a bright orange redish light travel out of the east to the south east for about 2 miles and went in the clouds only to return in the direction to the north west. lights stoped and hover for about 2 min. when a plane came out of the north the light slowly dimmed out. lost sight!
content.summary: A bright light that traveled about 2500 ft off the ground in holiday fl. very cool!
